timeline.bodyText:

+package com.hazelcast.client.impl.connection;
+
+import com.hazelcast.client.impl.protocol.ClientMessage;
+import com.hazelcast.client.impl.spi.EventHandler;
+import com.hazelcast.internal.nio.Connection;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * The ClientConnection is connection that lives on the client side on behalf of a Java client.
+ *
+ * On the server side there will be a {@link com.hazelcast.internal.server.ServerConnection}.
+ *
+ * Use this class to add client specific method.
+ */
+public interface ClientConnection extends Connection {
+
+    /**
+     * Returns the ClientConnectionManager of this ClientConnection.
+     *
+     * @return the ClientConnectionManager.
+     */
+    ClientConnectionManager getConnectionManager();

replies.bodyText:
It seems it isn't used. I'll remove the method.
I'm working on the EE portion.
replies.author: pveentjer

timeline.bodyText: This second method is not necessary. The users of getActiveTcpClientConnections can use getActiveConnections instead. I have checked them. ClientConnection interface is enough for them. They don't need need implementation class.
timeline.author: sancar
